description: In Spain, children are not allowed to leave home for any reason under strict coronavirus rules.
title: Coronavirus: Free our children from lockdown, says Barcelona mayor
title_page: Coronavirus: Free our children from lockdown, says Barcelona mayor - BBC News
maintext: Other countries have set age limits for going outside. Under-18s can only go outside in Poland and Bosnia if accompanied by an adult, while Italy - the country with Europe's highest recorded number of deaths at 21,645 - allows all children out if they are with a parent.
